sentence.text: In the end we just stood holding each other close , as the tears coursed down our faces .
Water coursed down Simon 's body as he stood , shaking with cold , on the beam .
We can feel the blood coursing through our veins again .
She turned her head away , scalding tears coursing down her cheeks and on to the pillow which had absorbed her earlier grief .
Googol 's voice was filled with black wonder , with a fearful admiration , a certain desolation of the heart , and yes , a horror that nevertheless coursed thrillingly through his nerves .
He stood quite still , shoulders shaking , tears coursing along the freckles .
Heat coursed into his face , and he prayed that it did not show .
Rivulets of water coursed down the panes , puddling on the sill .
She was crying hard now , tears coursing down her face over the pale curve of her cheeks .
He could feel his heart hammering in his chest , his blood coursing like a dark , hot tide in his veins .
They moved on again with the river coursing slowly in the growing light beside them and the birds darting out in front of their horses ' knees .
At the same time , tears coursed heedlessly down her cheeks and Bill , at her side , grinned as well .
She gave a tiny strangled gasp and shuddered , feeling the waves of shock coursing along her veins .
But she could n't help it ; the silent tears coursed out of her eyes and cascaded down her cheeks as she stared up at him , the betrayal wrenching at her heart .
